N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 924.1 - Reports by telephone

State Regulations

Immediate notice of the following classes of accidents
must be sent by telephone to 1-800-TO NYDOT (1-800-866-9368) 24 hours-a-day. The telephone report shall be transmitted within one hour of railroad
notification of the accident. The caller shall provide his or her name, title, telephone number and pertinent information regarding the accident: (a) all train and train service accidents
involving a passenger train; (b) any train or train service accident which causes delays to passenger train
movements of more than 30 minutes; (c) all collisions, except those minor
collisions which can be repaired without the need to move to a repair
facility; (d) all freight train
derailments: (1)
which occur on any tracks
where the maximum authorized track speed for movement of freight trains is
normally in excess of 25 miles per hour; (2)
which involve any freight car or cars
required to be placarded by the hazardous materials regulations (49 CFR part
172
); or
(3)
which, regardless of
lading, is a magnitude of more than five freight cars--or three freight cars if
consisting of articulated platforms; (e) any release or spill of a hazardous
material identified in 49 CFR part
172; (f) all bridge or other track opening
failures; (g) any accident
involving a steam powered locomotive; (h) all accidents at street or highway/rail
grade crossings; and
(i) all train
and train service accidents which result in death or in injury which results in
immediate hospitalization. Notes
